characterdesc-alchemist:
Beneath the rust, rot, and fetid flesh lies potential. Raw, mutable, and waiting to be refined.

Alchemists are brilliant scholars that flourish in a laboratory. But, a sheltered life full of research brings inexperience in combat.
characterdesc-artisan:
The world may crumble, but your work holds fast. Beauty is your defiance.

Artisans are talented individuals. Even when all hope is lost, they continue to create masterful works of art. But life as a kindhearted soul means that butchering animals is unthinkable.
characterdesc-chef:
You’ve seen what hunger does. The hollow eyes, the shaking hands, the silence around a cold hearth. So you keep the pot full, and the fire lit. Because you know that a warm meal can be all that stands between someone and the end.

Chefs are both knowledgeable and resourceful. Old recipes and traditions live on through them, but a life of being the heart of the town means that their careful hands lack the speed for ranged combat, and heavy armor slows their practiced movements.
characterdesc-oathkeeper:
Scholar, knight, fanatic; titles you wore like armor. Into the Rot you marched, charms clinking, faith burning, chasing the shimmer of the Prima Materia.

Oathkeepers have sworn themselves to The Forlorn Hope Order, seeking realms and powers immaterial to ours. They have a deep faith in the machine, and the arcane alongside it. This also means that they'll be more adverse to harming their beloved machines.
characterdesc-homesteader:
While others sought answers underground, you planted them in rows; letting the seasons decide what was worth keeping.

Homesteaders are masters of the harvest that excel with rotating crops, turning barren soil into fertile land, and butchering livestock. They struggle with the non-living minerals that reside under the surface of the earth, and despise the cramped tunnels that are associated with them.
characterdesc-lumberjack:
The trees there creak in a silent tongue. You never spoke back, only answered with clean cuts and lasting craft, turning their silence into structure.

Lumberjacks are skilled carpenters and arborists that are unrivaled in their particular set of skills and accompanying knowledge. Their knowledge doesn't extend much further than that however, leading to loss of ores and less damage against mechanicals.
characterdesc-mason:
We built walls to keep the cold out. We laid bricks to shelter against the storms. Clay, lime, ash, and time. That's all it takes to keep the darkness out.

Masons are skilled craftsmen specialized in the manipulation of stone, clay, and binding agents. With the continuous moving of heavy stones and repeated hard labor, comes a strength and hardyness unrivaled by many. Because of this though, they're far from sneaky.
characterdesc-merchant:
The world may have changed, but people haven't. They might have swapped their gold for gears, but you still know how to play the system.

Merchants specialize in trading, buying, selling, and haggling. They also know how to spot something valuble, but they're not too keen on combat or killing.
characterdesc-miner:
The snaking corridors and creaking hums are like a second home to you. The stone like a second skin. You make your way where most others fear to tread.

Miners mend tools in the field and spot ore others miss. The depths are home; the surface, unfamiliar.
characterdesc-mystic:
You held fast to your faith when theirs were abandoned. They didn't believe you when you told them you could hear the gears ticking below the ground. You'll show them they were wrong.

Mystics initially swore off any use of the prima materia, but now that it's here for good, they've learned to harness it. They've used this knowledge to explore the world, and assisted others in finding what was once lost. This skill with the living also means a lack of skill with the mechanical, and their untrained eyes don't spot ores as easily.
characterdesc-smith:
Copper or lead, bismuth or zinc, you have never met a metal you could not tame. You hear it sing in every hammer-blow. You feel it bloom with every stoke of the forge.

Smiths are talented laborers, capable of shaping metal into whatever they need. With calloused skin and rough hands, they don't burn easy. This also means their dexterity is rather low, and their stealth being practically nonexistant.
characterdesc-commonergloo:
Leave behind your old life. Crawl into the new world.

Commoners are generalists from a multitude of backgrounds. While they have no defining skills or strengths to speak of, they also lack the weaknesses of those who specialize.
characterdesc-huntergloo:
Loose the arrow, kill the beast. Take it home to your dying child. Eventually your child will die and you’ll find yourself providing for someone else’s dying child.

Hunters are ranged specialists that excel in the wild forests, plains, and mountains. They struggle in the confined tunnels of the underground.
characterdesc-malefactorgloo:
Terrible things are done in the heart of despair.
She is gone, but you remain.

Malefactors are tenacious survivors who can avoid unwanted attention and find loot that others might have missed. A heavy conscience leads to weakness in combat, however.
characterdesc-clockmakergloo:
The machines never stop ticking down there. You’ve seen to that.
You can hear them in your sleep.

Clockmakers are masters of precision and systems. They can easily dismantle or repair machinery, but they have no stomach for violence.
characterdesc-blackguardgloo:
Fight if you must. Kill if you must. Don’t look away.
A hard gaze on life will see you through.

Blackguards are fierce soldiers that thrive in a close-ranged skirmish, but a life of conflict has its downsides: They have no talent for delicate work and need more food to maintain their strength.
characterdesc-tailorgloo:
Make a fitting garb, so we may walk with grace once more.

Tailors provide stylish clothes and clothing repairs to stay warm during the winter months. A lifetime spent in the city leaves them ill-prepared for some hardships of nature.
traitdesc-temporaltransmutation: Has the ability to craft temporal gears, saltpeter, and high fertility soil via exclusive barrel recipes. Can also create prima materia
traitdesc-artisan: Exclusive craftable wallpapers, and can glaze Raw storage vessels, Raw flowerpots, Raw planters, and cheaper recipes for clay. Can also craft Refurbished crocks
traitdesc-bowyer: Exclusive craftable bows and arrows, and a quiver
traitdesc-culinary: Exclusive craftable Vintage beef, and metal cooking pots
traitdesc-shelflifesavant: Exclusive craftable rosin that doubles the longevity of food sealed in refurbished crocks
traitdesc-tinkerer: Exclusive craftable device to tame locusts, metal parts, better recipes for chutes, archimedes screws, hoppers, axles, and angled gears
traitdesc-locustlover: +50% hp to hacked locusts, and has the ability to heal hacked locusts with metal parts
traitdesc-pioneer: Exclusive craftable soil boosters, seeds, and a better recipe for terra preta
traitdesc-carpenter: Exclusive craftable wagon wheels, paper lanterns, aged firewood, aged logs, treasure chests, and better recipes for sticks, firewood, and boards
traitdesc-mason: Exclusive craftable advanced bloomery, exclusive craftable Hardened clay blocks, cheaper plaster recipe, cheaper mortar recipe, cheaper raw clay brick recipes, and cheaper unfired refractory brick recipes
traitdesc-specialstock: Able to access an exclusive shop for each trader
traitdesc-masquemonger: Each mask holds a story... some happy, some sad. All of them worth wearing; at least once. (able to craft all masks in the game)
traitdesc-prospector: Exclusive craftable prospector's pack, toolkits, mining lanterns, copper pan, cheaper blasting powder recipes, and cheaper bomb recipes
traitdesc-shelteredstone: No temporal stability loss whilst underground, no matter how deep.
traitdesc-mystic: Exclusive craftable crystal skull, craftable prima materia, and cheaper recipes for parchment, and linen fiber pulp
traitdesc-clairvoyance: Able to use the crystal skull to find broken static translocators
traitdesc-smith: Exclusive craftable armor kits, metal barrels for the alchemist, stainless steel mix to be used in the advanced bloomery
traitdesc-recycler: Can break down rusty gears, metal scraps, and metal parts for metals of that type
traitdesc-tallowtanner: Can recycle unused pelts into scraped hides
traitdesc-zealot: Exclusive craftable Temporal cloth, Forlorn Hope estoc and a cheaper recipe for prima materia
charattribute-flaxFiberChance-0.1: +10% chance to get flax fibers from grass
charattribute-flaxDropRate-0.2: +20% more flax fibers from flax crops
charattribute-stickDropRate-0.5: +50% chance to get double sticks from branches
charattribute-armorWalkSpeedAffectedness: walk speed penalty for wearing armor reduced by 15%
walk speed penalty for wearing armor reduced by 20%
walk speed penalty for wearing armor increased by 5%
charattribute-clayformingPoints-5: +5 voxels for each piece of clay used in clayforming
charattribute-caveStabilityLoss-0.1: +10% faster temporal stability loss in caves
charattribute-surfaceStabilityLoss--0.00: Gradual temporal stability loss when outside or when not in a room
